summary: Email chain between federal prosecutors and Metropolitan Correctional Center staff regarding a subpoena and request for inmate Jeffrey Epstein's phone call recordings and email correspondence from July 6-11, 2019, excluding communications with his attorneys. The emails discuss logistics and confirm the absence of calls or emails for Epstein at that time.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the subpoena and request for phone call recordings and email correspondence while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Blachman, Eric
persons.context: Federal prosecutor with the Southern District of New York who sent the subpoena and request for Epstein's communications, excluding attorney calls.

persons.name: Supervisory Staff Attorney
persons.context: Legal staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center who confirmed no calls or emails for Epstein were available at the time.

connections.description: Prosecutor subpoenaing and requesting communications from the incarcerated defendant.
Correctional center legal staff responding to a prosecutor's request for inmate communications.

events.title: Subpoena for Epstein's Communications
events.description: Federal prosecutors issue a subpoena and written request for Jeffrey Epstein's phone call recordings and email correspondence from July 6-11, 2019, while he was incarcerated.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On July 12, 2019, federal prosecutors were actively subpoenaing Jeffrey Epstein's jail communications (phone calls and emails) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The request specifically sought records from July 6, 2019, through July 11, 2019, indicating investigative activity in the days following his arrest.
The subpoena explicitly excluded communications between Epstein and his attorneys, respecting attorney-client privilege.
MCC staff confirmed they had 'no calls or emails for Epstein at this time' in response to the initial request.
The document shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and correctional facility legal staff regarding evidence collection.
